trial_identification.studytitle: Drug-Eluting Stent Study Evaluating a New Technology in Patients with Symptomatic Ischemic Heart Disease due to Coronary Artery Blockage
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluating the Svelte Drug Eluting Stent-on-a-Wire (DESOAW) in Patients with Symptomatic Ischemic Heart Disease due to Coronary Artery Blockage

interventions.interventions: The percutaneous revascularization of native coronary arteries exhibiting stenotic lesion(s) using a novel sirolimus-eluting cobalt chromium stent with bioerodable drug carrier delivered via fixed-wire catheter system is similar to current stenting procedures. Depending on difficulty of lesion treatment, procedures, typcially under conscious sedation, take between 30 and 90 minutes and are conducted in the cardiology cath lab. A small puncture in the groin or arm provides arterial access to place a stent in the heart using x-ray fluoroscopy for visualization during the procedure. Ususally this is a one-time procedure; however, some patients experience re-clogging of the target artery and have to return for reinitervention.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1 and 6 months and yearly through 5 years post-procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Composite of cardiac death, MI attributed to the target vessel revascularization
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1 and 6 months post-procedure, and yearly up to 5 years

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Stent thrombosis as determined by the attending physician
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1 and 6 months and yearly for5 years post-procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: In-stent and in-segment angiographic binary restenosis
In-stent and in-segment minimum lumen diameter as assessed by IVUS
In-segment late lumen loss as assessed by IVUS
Neointimal hyperplasia (% lumen volume) measured by Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS)
Strut coverage (% of struts malapposed, protruding non-covered, protruding covered, non-protruding covered) measured by optical coherence tomography (OCT)

trial_design.concealment: Pateint qualifies based on study eligibility criteria; once enrolled, intention is to treat with study product for all patients.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The objective of this trial is to assess the safety and clinical performance of the novel Svelte DESOAW Coronary Stent System with fully bioerodable drug carrier eluting the well-studied drug compound sirolimus in patients with single de novo coronary artery lesions.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Multi-Region Ethics Committee Ministry of Health No. 1 The Terrace PO Box 5013 Wellington 6145
